content: Is it possible to design a type of hardware which would allow safe rust to talk to components without sacrificing memory safety? Can we ever reliably prevent environmental factors from affecting the hardware and thus the software?
rust was never designed in terms of protecting against stuff like cosmic radiation
and nowadays companies use a hardware-level solution where they employ multiple CPUs who cooperate and check their results for outliers, at least that's what spaceX does
rust cannot reasonably protect against environmental or hardware-level factors, it's just outside of scope
i mean it can't even protect against user or kernel level issues like the OS or a program modifying the memory of the program

we would need rust hardware that is shielded against radiation and a child with a screwdriver, but thats not 100% foolproof so we would need to make our own universe that somehow does not have cosmic radiation, im sure the physicists will have a blast.
